segments.script:
Morning, friends! It's Julie here on your favorite community radio station, Appalachia Radio. 

It's a brand new day in the hills, and I'm so glad you're joining me for the morning show at 8:00 sharp! The sun's just starting to peek over those beautiful Appalachian mountains - isn't it a glorious sight?

Remember, if you're out there and you're listening... you are not alone. We've got each other through all of this, and together, we'll rebuild stronger than ever. Stay safe, stay hopeful, and tune in for more uplifting tunes and messages!

I'm Julie, your friendly neighborhood DJ, signing off until next time on Appalachia Radio!

I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard a rumor that there's a secret vault hidden deep in the mountains. Someone told me it's not even on the maps, but supposedly Vault 87 is real and still intact. Can you imagine? A whole vault full of people who survived the Great War! 

Of course, word is the entrance is heavily guarded by those nasty Scorched. So if anyone's planning a trip there, make sure you bring plenty of med-x and a strong gun. I mean, I haven't tried to find it myself, but hey, maybe one day we'll uncover some big secrets.

Anyway, let's focus on the music! Here's "Wild Horses" by The Rolling Stones - another pre-war favorite that seems to still resonate with us in the wasteland today. Stay safe out there and keep those ears tuned to Appalachia Radio!

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia! I hope you're all doing well out there in the wilds. Julie here on your favorite radio station.

So, word is... some folks have spotted a peculiar Brahmin lately. Like two heads growing out of the same body! Now, I know what you're thinking - that sounds like one crazy mutie! But apparently, it's been seen by multiple people in different parts of the region.

Someone told me they even tried to help the poor thing, 'cause it was struggling a bit. Guess those extra brains might be more of a hindrance than a help sometimes? I mean, imagine having two minds trying to work together! That'd be like... well, I don't know what that would be like, but probably something.

Anyway, just thought you should hear about this strange sight. Take it for what it's worth - maybe just a myth or an overactive imagination running wild. But hey, if you do spot that two-headed Brahmin, give it some extra oats from me, okay? This is Julie, signing off for now. Stay safe out there!
